result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis J Heal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED - Conditions of Extended Supervision are the same as conditions of probation that is imposed
.

miscConds.notes:
Pay $150 for Buy Money on Joint & Several basis with Kou V. (15CF840)

Restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the PO but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment
.

Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing

No Contact with users or traffickers of illicit drugs or controlled substances
.

Participate in and successfully complete the Drug Court Program

Complete any other assessments the PO deems necessary and follow-through with any recommendations made

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

 If probation/extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

timeConds.notes:
The Drug Court Team can release the defendant to Electronic Monitoring once an appropriate placement plan has been identified
.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travis J Heal

records.addlTxt: Def has completed SAP - Amendment to JOC that DOC will effectuate change from confinement to extended supervision - signed by SLH

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
State by Kellis / Def NA
DRUG COURT
CRT:  Def has been an absconder for 3 weeks - this is 2nd time def has absconded.  Team has ability to expel for non-participation.  There was a Motion made to expel & concensus of the team is to expel
CRT will accept that Motion & Expels def from DRG CRT program.  Upon arrest, def will be held in custody on PO Hold until revocation of probation
Atty Gregg Waterman's Petition to Withdraw as Counsel - Order signed by SLH

Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment filed
  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed

State by Skemp /  Def in custody w/ Atty Gregg Watermann
Sentencing recommendations made
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence filed
CRT'S SENTENCE:  Def sentenced to STAYED & IMPOSED sentence - WSP for total length of time of 6 yrs & 6 mos:
- Initial Term of Confinement is 3 yrs & 6 mos STAYED - Def is eligible for CIP & SAP
- Extended Supervision is 3 yrs STAYED - conditions are same as probation imposed
PROBATION IMPOSED for 3 yrs w/ conditions:  6 mos CJ w/ credit for 92 days - DRG CRT Team will release def to EM once an approp placement plan has been identified;  AODA & follow-thru w/ trmt recommended;  Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or cont subs w/o valid prescription, w/ random testing;  Participate in & successfully complete the DRG CRT Program;  Complete any other assessments or evaluations deemed necessary by the PO & follow-thru w/ recommendations;  No Contact w/ Drug users or traffickers;  Pay rest. of $150 for Buy Money on Joint & Several basis w/ K.V (15CF840);  Pay CC & DOC fees
From: SLH To: Anne Patton/Drug Court Coord Re: req def be assess for entry to Drug Court program

3:00 PM - (w/ 15CM1661) Def in court w/ Atty Gregg Earl Waterman.  Def in custody.  Brian Keith Barton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CF3
Ct. 1 - delivery of heroin - NO CONTEST
15CM1661 - dismissed and read in
SNP filed/signed/understands
Consolidation papers filed
  Plea Quest filed/signed/understands
Understands const rights waived
Understands elements of crime
No promises/threats
No alc/drugs/meds in the last 24 hrs
  Plea is F, V & I made. Sufficient factual basis to support the plea and the def is found guilty.
PSI is requested
WATERMAN: he has work he believes. He has no BJ or escape charges and hasn't missed any court in the past yr. Ask for a sig bond CRT: looking at the PT report showing high risk and 12/21 bond violation for failure to report on  12/17.  DEF: I didn't hear the judge say to report. BARTON: defer to the court. This is a serious charge and believe some cash is approp. CRT: the PT  report suggests high risk w/ hx of failing to appear. It appears some of the hx is traffic. Cash is required
$1000.00 cash bond - same conditions 10P- 6 AM curfew except for employment. Report to JSS immediately after the bond is posted to get set up w/ testing schedule.
SENT:  7 weeks - Andrea to set
PSI due one week b/f sentencing

11:08 am   Def in court w/ Atty Gregg Earl Waterman.  Def in custody.  Brian Keith Barton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea discussions.  Prelim waiver filed - signed/understands.  No promises/threats.
COURT finds the waiver of the PH is F & V made.  Bound over for trial.
Information filed - Reading waived.  Def Stands Mute - NG Pleas entered.
PTC:  2/12 at 2:30 pm     STC:  3/3 at 10 am   SLH
Waterman argues for a sig. bond.  Court:  Has a compass been completed?  Barton doesn't think one was ordered.
COURT will order a compass evaluation.
Bond to continue.

Cash bond required to remain.
